overview: This elective subject builds on Orchestral Performance Practicum 1 by providing students a performance-focused, work-integrated learning experience with a professional orchestra. By attending and playing in rehearsals and through professional mentoring on orchestral techniques and excerpts, students gain practical rehearsal experience with, and further develop communication skills required by, a professional orchestra.
This subject is only available to Master of Music (Orchestral Performance) students.

This subject provides students with a placement opportunity for participation with a partnered professional orchestra. Students are required to complete 22-hours of placement. Students are responsible for identifying a suitable placement with support from the subject coordinator. All placements must be approved by the subject coordinator, typically through an audition.
This subject has a placement component that may require travel within Greater Melbourne, Victoria, or interstate.
This subject may incur costs in addition to tuition fees. These costs include accommodation, food, and travel, to undertake chosen placement.
ilo: demonstrate and critically evaluate standards in professional orchestral ensemble rehearsals;
demonstrate appropriate rehearsal etiquette for professional situations;
employ appropriate performance styles and practices;
demonstrate and critically evaluate rehearsal practice for works studied.
generic_skills: communicate effectively in oral and written language, and in musical performance;
communicate constructively in diverse professional situations;
promote and maintain the wellbeing of self and others;
integrate personal reflection into the creative process;
make effective use of planning skills.

Prerequisites.content: Admission into the MC-MUSORP Master of Music (Orchestral Performance)
Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)

assessment.brief: Work Integrated Learning Placement: quality, thoroughness and timeliness of activities as assigned in industry partner work integrated learning placement (22 hours of placement)
assessment.hurdle: A workplace supervisor's report confirming your punctual and reliable attendance, active participation and 'appropriate endeavour' at your placement.

assessment.brief: Work Placement Report: report of work placement, including a critical reflective self-appraisal, duties performed, and learning outcomes.

assessment.hurdle: Attendance at all scheduled activities as assigned by industry partner organisation throughout placement.
